results.title: Wild weather
results.creator_credit: Will Aslett, British Broadcasting Corporation and TLC Films
results.brief_description: Wild weather is proof that the Earth and its weather can be made into an interesting and fun documentary series. The effervescent presenter Donal MacIntyre is an adventurer and extreme sports fan who takes us on a journey around the world to discover how the weather works - from a gentle breeze to an extreme tornado. Admittedly most of the action takes place in the Northern Hemisphere but it is well made television with 3D computer animation aiding the storytelling. “Wind” shows the way wind is created around the Earth. “Wet” shows how rain is made and can reach the extremes of killer storms. “Cold” deals with snow and glaciers and “Heat” looks at deserts and lightning.

results.title: Wild swans
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Anne Scorer, BBC-TV and Scorer Associates
results.brief_description: Based on the critically acclaimed account of the lives of three Chinese women spanning three generations. The book “Wild Swans” has been a best seller world-wide except in China where a Government ban prevents its publication or distribution. The book was conceived when Jung Chang’s mother visited Britain in 1990 and provided her with a detailed account of the family history. The film recreates this period of discussion and recollection between mother and daughter, interwoven with archival and contemporary Chinese film and photographs and readings by the author from her book. “Wild Swans” conveys both the extraordinary personal qualities of the author and how ordinary lives are shaped by historical forces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mischa Scorer, Anne Scorer, BBC-TV and Scorer Associates

results.title: Wild September snow
results.creator_credit: John King, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A New Zealand tourist film of ski-instructors chasing two winters around the world. Shows various ski areas in the North Island, glimpses of ski villages, the Southern Alps and some spectacular scenery and skiing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John King, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Wild life refuge
results.brief_description: Describes the four major routes in the United States. Emphasises the importance of a practical programme for conserving wild fowl, the role of refuges, provision of food and water and treatment of migrating ducks, geese, and other species, shown in spring and autumn at the Klamath Basin, a typical national refuge.

results.title: Wild highlands
results.creator_credit: Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A picturesque and beautiful film study of wild life in the western Highlands of Scotland, on the Ardnamurchan peninsula. By the sea, herons, oyster catchers, and ringer lovers tend their young; on the hill, the wild cat prowls, the fox preys upon rabbits and the eagle chick waits to be fed. Exciting sequences include an antler battle.

results.title: Wild flowers of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Shows some of the better known wildflowers of Western Australia. The first section deals with the sand plain flowers between Moora and Carnarvon; the second section covers the flowers of the South West forests.
results.description: Shows some of the better known wildflowers of Western Australia. The first section deals with the sand plain flowers between Moora and Carnarvon; the second section covers the flowers of the South West forests.

results.title: Wild flowers of spring
results.brief_description: This film was produced in collaboration with the Botanical Gardens, Sydney and the Australian Museum, Sydney. Includes brief views of the Waratah, flannel flower, five corners, native heath, bottle brush, red and pink spider flowers, wax flower, Boronia rose, wedding bush.

results.title: Wild Dog Dingo
results.creator_credit: Gary Steer, One World Films and Sky Visuals
results.brief_description: The dingo - a mysterious and controversial animal. Filmed over three years, this program shows the natural behaviour of dingoes as never seen before. It follows the life cycle from mating, birth and the growth of pups to adults. The dingo emerges as a tough, resourceful survivor that has earned itself an important part in the Australian legend.

results.title: Wild crocodile hunt [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lynn Laurence, Phillip J Phillips and PJP Productions
results.brief_description: A film about a crocodile hunt beginning at Coen, last town on Cape York Peninsula, North Queensland, and ending at Annie River. Shows skinning of crocodile with the carcass being left behind for the carrier to collect. Includes scenes of crocodiles being shot, with some only being wounded and able to escape the hunters. Narration by John Scott Griffiths. Photography by Rene Henri.
